trial_identification.scientifictitle: A new multi-level complex intervention to redress delays in symptoms appraisal, general practitioner (GP) diagnosis and referral and access to optimal treatments for rural patients with cancer - development phase

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Bowel - Back passage (rectum) or large bowel (colon)

interventions.interventions: a multi-level complex 'best prospects' intervention will be designed based on a review of the available literature (from all periods) as well as qualitative assessments. The intervention will be designed to redress health system, doctor and patient factors that affect outcomes in rural patients with cancer of the prostate, breast, colorectum or lung. It is expected that the development phase will take approx. 2 years.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The initial development phase will measure the different components of delay to treatment that could impact on poorer outcomes in rural cancer patients and gather knowledge of patient decision-making about symptom appraisal and the type and location of treatment of their cancer.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: In the development phase of the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Delay times in rural patients newly presenting with cancer using surveys and questionnaires
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: In the intervention phase of the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Clinical endpoints (including stage at diagnosis, optimal Initial treatment, inactive disease after initial treatment, time to recurrence and time to death) using information from medical records
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: In the intervention phase of the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patient confidence in providers and satisfaction with care using questionnaires and interviews.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: In the intervention phase of the study

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: eligible and consenting patients living in selected rural areas with newly diagnosed cancers of the prostate, breast, colorectum or lung

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Population Health & School of Primary, Aboriginal and Rural Health Care, University of Western Australia 35 Stirling Highway, CRAWLEY WA 6009

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 1 16 Marcus Clarke Street Canberra ACT 2601

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Primary Care Collaborative Cancer Clinical Trials Group (PC4)
secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: The University of Western Australia M706, 328 Stirling Highway Claremont WA 6010

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The project will consist of two intimately-linked phases over a five-year term: a development phase, which will identify health system, doctor and patient factors that affect outcomes in rural patients with cancer of the prostate, breast, colorectum or lung and assess their potential to be modified by a complex intervention; and an implementation/evaluation phase, in which the best prospects intervention will be rigorously evaluated by an experimental trial.
